## Description {#details}

Lightweight error class with error context and mandatory checking.

Instances of this class wrap a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorinfobase">ErrorInfoBase</a> pointer. Failure states are represented by setting the pointer to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorinfobase">ErrorInfoBase</a> subclass instance containing information describing the failure. Success is represented by a null pointer value.

Instances of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> also contains a &#39;Checked&#39; flag, which must be set before the destructor is called, otherwise the destructor will trigger a runtime error. This enforces at runtime the requirement that all <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instances be checked or returned to the caller.

There are two ways to set the checked flag, depending on what state the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instance is in. For <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instances indicating success, it is sufficient to invoke the boolean conversion operator. E.g.:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a7245b97586de88539c5dc656b6e7f38d">Error</a> foo(&lt;...&gt;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = foo(&lt;...&gt;))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &lt;- Return E if it is in the error state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We have verified that E was in the success state. It can now be safely</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// destroyed.</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


A success value <em>can not</em> be dropped. For example, just calling &#39;foo(&lt;...&gt;)&#39; without testing the return value will raise a runtime error, even if foo returns success.

For <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instances representing failure, you must use either the handleErrors or handleAllErrors function with a typed handler. E.g.:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">MyErrorInfo : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ErrorInfo&lt;MyErrorInfo&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Custom error info.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a7245b97586de88539c5dc656b6e7f38d">Error</a> foo(&lt;...&gt;) &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9999bd897fc8a1648bd69b36fee2d357">make&#95;error&lt;MyErrorInfo&gt;</a>(...); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = foo(&lt;...&gt;); </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &lt;- foo returns failure with MyErrorInfo.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewE =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a2c831eabfe62504c9cc0cc16e0799c44">handleErrors</a>(std::move(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    &#91;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MyErrorInfo &amp;M) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Deal with the error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    &#91;&#93;(std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;OtherError&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>) -&gt; <a href="#a7245b97586de88539c5dc656b6e7f38d">Error</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (canHandle(&#42;M)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handle error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a4dfd0813c3d0e0a30439b5a3e9196b59">Error::success</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Couldn&#39;t handle this error instance. Pass it up the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a7245b97586de88539c5dc656b6e7f38d">Error</a>(std::move(M));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note - The error passed to handleErrors will be marked as checked. If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there is no matched handler, a new error with the same payload is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// created and returned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The handlers take the error checked by handleErrors as an argument,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which can be used to retrieve more information. If a new error is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// created by a handler, it will be passed back to the caller of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handleErrors and needs to be checked or return up to the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, the passed-in error is considered consumed.</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


The handleAllErrors function is identical to handleErrors, except that it has a void return type, and requires all errors to be handled and no new errors be returned. It prevents errors (assuming they can all be handled) from having to be bubbled all the way to the top-level.

<em>All</em> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> instances must be checked before destruction, even if they&#39;re moved-assigned or constructed from Success values that have already been checked. This enforces checking through all levels of the call stack.

Definition at line 160 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.

### handleErrors {#a2c831eabfe62504c9cc0cc16e0799c44}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>friend <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> E, HandlerTs &amp;&amp;... Handlers</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> the ErrorInfo(s) contained in E to their respective handlers.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> unhandled errors (or Errors returned by handlers) are re-concatenated and returned. Because this function returns an error, its result must also be checked or returned. If you intend to handle all errors use handleAllErrors (which returns void, and will abort() on unhandled errors) instead.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00168">168</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00192">192</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.

### Error() {#a1c1f5fe40e458b271781c97954d518b6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::Error::Error (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> &amp;&amp; Other)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Move-construct an error value.

The newly constructed error is considered unchecked, even if the source error had been checked. The original error becomes a checked Success value, regardless of its original state.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00197">197</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  prototype={<>llvm::Error::Error (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorinfobase">ErrorInfoBase</a> &gt; Payload)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Create an error value.

Prefer using the &#39;make&#95;error&#39; function, but this constructor can be useful when &quot;re-throwing&quot; errors from handlers.

## Public Operators

### operator bool() {#a981b4992a3b7cce718c7995a7d6193a0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="llvm::Error::operator bool ()"
  labels = {["inline", "explicit"]}>
Bool conversion.

Returns true if this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> is in a failure state, and false if it is in an accept state. If the error is in a Success state it will be considered checked.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00241">241</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["delete"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00210">210</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.

### operator=() {#ae6cd5f6ac32dc47c9437c7315fb79444}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error &amp; llvm::Error::operator= (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> &amp;&amp; Other)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Move-assign an error value.

The current error must represent success, you you cannot overwrite an unhandled error. The current error is then considered unchecked. The source error becomes a checked success value, regardless of its original state.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h/#l00216">216</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
